com.salesforce.androidsdk.auth
Class HttpAccess

java.lang.Object
  BroadcastReceiver
      com.salesforce.androidsdk.auth.HttpAccess

public class HttpAccess
extends BroadcastReceiver

Generic HTTP Access layer - used internally by RestClient and OAuth2. Basically a wrapper around an AndroidHttpClient. It watches network changes (e.g. wifi to 3g) and resets the AndroidHttpClient when needed.

Nested Class Summary

          Wrapper around an HTTP call and its response.

Method Detail

init

                        java.lang.String userAgent)
Initialize HttpAccess. Should be called from application

onReceive

public void onReceive(Context context,
                      Intent intent)
Detects network changes and resets the network when needed. Note: The intent info is only for this particular change, meaning it will get sent when the phone detects changes in the wireless state even though the user is actually using wifi. In other words, don't use it; look for the current real state using the manager service.

Parameters:
context - The context of the request.
intent - Not used.

resetNetwork

public void resetNetwork()
Shut down existing connections and create a new http client.
